title: Exploring Factors Influencing Persistence in Mobile Learning: A Qualitative Phenomenological Study in Mathematical Learning Contexts

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Mathematics Knowledge and Basic Smartphone Usage Skills
context.additional_context: A course analyzing sustained use intentions based on mobile-based mathematics learning experiences in post-COVID-19 non-face-to-face environments. Learners primarily access content via smartphones, with a structure combining biweekly face-to-face workshops and mobile-based assignments

learning_goals: Learners can specifically describe 15 influencing factors (practical use, attitude, context, etc.) experienced during mathematical problem-solving in mobile learning environments.
Learners can measure and analyze factors determining their learning persistence using self-assessment tools when utilizing smartphone-based learning tools.
Learners can design three or more personal strategies (e.g., self-regulated learning, motivation techniques) to enhance mobile learning persistence.

resources: Mobile Learning Apps (e.g., GeoGebra, Khan Academy)
Digital Portfolio Template for Recording Learning Experiences
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
